00001 /*! \file 
00002     \brief Holds the implementation of the synchronization sub-system. */
00003 
00004 #include "kernel.h"
00005 #include "sync.h"
00006 
00007 /* The function interfaces are documented in sync.h */
00008 
00009 struct port
00010 port_table[MAX_NUMBER_OF_PORTS];
00011 
00012 void
00013 initialize_ports(void)
00014 {
00015  register int i;
00016 
00017  /* Loop over all ports in the table and set the owner to -1 indicating a 
00018     free port. */
00019  for(i=0; i<MAX_NUMBER_OF_PORTS; i++)
00020  {
00021   port_table[i].owner=-1;
00022  }
00023 }
00024 
00025 int
00026 allocate_port(const unsigned long id, const int new_owner)
00027 {
00028  register int i;
00029  register int first_available=-1;
00030 
00031  /* Loop over all ports to see if the port has already been allocated. */
00032  for(i=0; i<MAX_NUMBER_OF_PORTS; i++)
00033  {
00034   /* We keep track of the first available port. This way we do not
00035      have to scan the table twice. */
00036   if ((-1 == port_table[i].owner) &&
00037       (-1 == first_available))
00038   {
00039    first_available=i;
00040   }
00041 
00042   /* Check if the port entry match the one we want to create. */
00043   if ((new_owner == port_table[i].owner) &&
00044       (id == port_table[i].id))
00045   {
00046    return -1;
00047   }
00048  }
00049 
00050  if (-1 != first_available)
00051  {
00052   /* Set the new owner and new identity. */
00053   port_table[first_available].owner=new_owner;
00054   port_table[first_available].id=id;
00055 
00056   /* Initially, the sender queue is  empty and there are no receiving thread. */
00057   port_table[first_available].receiver=-1;
00058   thread_queue_init(&port_table[first_available].sender_queue);
00059 
00060   return first_available;
00061  }
00062 
00063  /* Return -1 if we ran out of ports. */
00064  return -1;
00065 }
00066 
00067 int
00068 find_port(const unsigned long id, const int owner)
00069 {
00070  register int i;
00071 
00072  /* Loop over all ports in the table. */
00073  for(i=0; i<MAX_NUMBER_OF_PORTS; i++)
00074  {
00075   /* Return as soon as we find a match. */
00076   if ((owner == port_table[i].owner) &&
00077       (id == port_table[i].id))
00078   {
00079    return i;
00080   }
00081  }
00082 
00083  return -1;
00084 }
